Cage.Action: Taps a button to open faceplate despite warnings, showing nervousness but also a desire to cope with fear.
Taps a button to open his faceplate despite the deafening roar, showing awareness of his environment and attempting to manage his fear.
Expresses fear and confusion about his situation, questioning what he is doing here.
Trembles and shuts his eyes during the drop, showing fear but no hostile or dismissive behavior toward others.
Does not abandon or mock others despite fear; unable to jump but no indication of selfishness or cruelty.
Trembles and shuts his eyes during the drop, unable to jump when ordered.
Despite fear, remains physically present and does not flee or abandon position.
Screams and flails while falling but manages to activate his jacket's autoland to survive the drop.
Stares in shock at a dying soldier trapped under the burning dropship.
Responds to Yonaburu's call and prepares to move forward despite the chaos.
Screams and flails while falling out of the dropship, showing panic and lack of control.
Activates his jacket's autoland jets at the last second to cushion his fall and avoid injury.
Quickly recovers from the fall, staggers up, and assesses the terrain and friendly forces using his heads-up display.
Stares in shock at the burning dropship and dying soldier, showing momentary hesitation or emotional overwhelm.
Runs after Yonaburu to join the company despite the chaos and danger.
Expresses mounting horror and fear for his company and their fate.
Runs blindly after Yonaburu without apparent strategy or caution.
Struggles to move effectively in the exojacket, indicating lack of practice or preparation.
Jumps and lands badly, then scrambles up, showing physical clumsiness under pressure.
Tumbles into the trench with other terrified soldiers, indicating lack of control or composure.
Quickly notices the approaching enemy dots on his heads-up display and tries to assess the situation.
Expresses realization that the situation is worse than expected, showing situational awareness.
Is frozen to the spot, trembling, unable to move during the Mimic attack.
Is frozen to the spot, trembling, unable to move during an attack.
Expresses fear and panic aloud ('Oh god oh god oh god') when cut off and facing imminent death.
Lifts his weapon, shaking, trying to pick a target but is unable to do so under pressure.
Deserts the frontline battle, running away from combat while comrades fight.
Deserts the battle, running away from the front line and leaving comrades behind.
Attempts to escape imminent danger by scrambling up a rocky bluff to evade pursuing enemies.
Drags Yonaburu to the crest of the cliff despite danger, showing concern for his comrade.
Kicks and flails to escape Yonaburu's grip, prioritizing his own survival over unit cohesion.
Shouts 'YONABURU!' and 'NO!' after Yonaburu is shot, showing emotional reaction and care.
Kicks and flails to escape Yonaburu's grip despite the danger, showing desperation but also determination.
Drags Yonaburu to the crest of the cliff, attempting to escape and gain a tactical position.
Fires blindly at the Mimics, killing six in 2.3 seconds despite poor aim and lack of control, showing raw effectiveness and luck.
Falls on his ass and continues firing while under attack, demonstrating persistence but lack of finesse.
Is surprised by the Mimics and their tactics, indicating a lack of situational awareness.
Gets hit twice by javelins, one to the side and one shattering his faceplate, leading to blackout.
Struggles to defend himself despite being injured and outnumbered by mimics.
Screams for help when overwhelmed by mimics.
Allows Rita to help him without resistance, showing vulnerability and trust.
Struggles to lift his weapon and tries to fire despite being severely wounded and out of ammo.
Screams in panic when mimics approach and his weapon fails.
Survives a brutal attack and remains conscious enough to interact with Rita.
Expresses fear and vulnerability about dying, cries, and admits he doesn't want to die.
Bitterly offers his fresh battery to Rita, saying he doesn't deserve it.
Crawls to Yonaburu's side and apologizes deliriously.
Tells Rita to 'Fuck off' when she wishes him good luck.
Offers his fresh battery to Rita despite his own dire condition.
Crawls to Yonaburu's side with the last of his strength despite being bloody and weak.
Trembles, coughs blood, and shows signs of helplessness when a Mimic approaches.
Expresses fear and despair openly, saying he doesn't want to die and apologizing deliriously.
Grabs Mrs. Smith pistol and shoots the mimic multiple times despite extreme pain and risk to himself.
Grabs a pistol from the mud and shoots the mimic directly between its armor plates, causing significant damage and disrupting its attack.
Closes his eyes and fires under extreme stress and pain, showing determination despite the danger.
Screams and reacts in pain as the mimic's tendrils burn him, indicating vulnerability but also a natural human response.
Defaces recruitment poster with insulting graffiti.
Responds to teasing with mild irritation but no aggression.
Shows vulnerability by admitting to a nightmare and physical discomfort.
Stares around like a trapped animal, confused about the situation, and fails to maintain composure in front of others.
Defaces recruitment poster with mocking graffiti, showing lack of seriousness and professionalism.
Acknowledges his hangover and physical discomfort, attempts to take aspirin and regain composure.
Frowns, worried about the mission plans and the soldiers' wellbeing.
Asks Ford to stop gambling to avoid exhausting the soldiers again.
Distracted and dazed, staring at faces of fallen soldiers.
Frowns, worried about the mission plan and seems to have a sense of foreboding or intuition about events.
Distractedly interrupts a game of cards to complain about physical training, showing some awareness of team fatigue.
Tries to alert others about an intruder by saying 'Dude, he came RIGHT through that door, and —'
Is caught off guard and shows wide eyes when Kimmel is slapped and the game is knocked away
Stares stunned at the harsh treatment and intense situation without immediate reaction.
Shares his strange premonition openly with Yonaburu, showing vulnerability and a desire to connect.
Attempts to warn others about upcoming events (like Kimmel fainting and a fight between Nance and Ford).
Accurately predicts immediate future events during physical training, showing awareness and recall beyond normal experience.
Appears dazed and sweating, indicating stress and possible confusion despite his predictions.
Narrates the fight with humor and excitement, engaging with others around him.
Stops talking abruptly and shows bewilderment when Rita arrives, indicating respect or surprise rather than mockery.
Accurately narrates and observes the chaotic fight, noting key events and outcomes with clarity and detail.
Trails off mid-sentence when noticing Rita's unexpected arrival, showing momentary distraction or surprise.
Does not intervene in the fight despite witnessing escalating violence and injuries.
Keeps eyes on Rita despite the difficult exercise, then looks down when caught, showing respect and self-awareness.
Does not mock or smirk at struggling soldiers, unlike others who smirk at Yonaburu.
Fails to maintain the iso-pushup position, showing physical weakness but no sign of complaint or excuse.
Tries to maintain discipline and focus during the iso-pushup exercise but ultimately fails and drops out.
Attempts to avoid eye contact with Rita when caught looking, showing awareness of military decorum.
Admits to being troubled and uncertain when questioned by Yonaburu about his experience with Rita.
Avoids joining the platoon's liquor raid, showing hesitation or reluctance to participate in group bonding activities.
Shaking and ultimately drops during a physical challenge while others perform effortlessly.
Denies having a dream or hallucination about Rita despite appearing troubled and uncertain.
Shows hesitation and uncertainty about joining a ritual liquor raid with his platoon.
Does not argue against joining the ritual drinking before battle despite initial hesitation.
Questions the ritual of drinking before battle by pointing out they've never been in a battle.
Does not take up Sgt. Farell's offer for in-jacket training, like the other soldiers.
Helps Yonaburu to his bunk when he is too drunk to walk.
Picks up Yonaburu's dropped photo and responds supportively about it.
Reassures Yonaburu about the dream and his survival.
Sits off by himself, somewhat withdrawn from others.
Helps Yonaburu to his bunk when he is too drunk to walk.
Hesitates but drinks the offered bottle, showing some social adaptability.
Calmly reassures Yonaburu about the dream and his fate, showing emotional intelligence and confidence.
Sits off by himself, staring out at the breakers, possibly withdrawn or contemplative.
Appears anxious but well-prepared, heavily armed, and focused on the mission.
Equips himself with an excessive amount of ammo, grenades, and guns, indicating over-preparation but also anxiety.
Waves his arms frantically to warn other soldiers of the falling dropship, giving them a chance to look up.
Hyperventilates and shows visible terror during the drop, focusing on his own fear.
Hits his release and drops from the dropship without hesitation despite fear.
Waves his arms frantically to warn other soldiers of the falling dropship, giving them time to look up.
Appears anxious and terrified, hyperventilating and struggling with fear.
Waves arms frantically to warn doomed soldiers, giving them a chance to look up before the dropship crashes.
Runs away blindly from the trench after a comrade is killed, ignoring Yonaburu's attempts to stop him.
Waves arms frantically to warn soldiers, giving them time to look up before dropship crash.
Nods dazed after being thrown back, then runs with Yonaburu to the trench.
On heads-up, notices red dots (enemies) approaching his company.
Runs away blindly when a comrade is killed, ignoring others' calls to stay.
Wriggles free and crawls away after being tackled by Yonaburu.
Commands to get out of here amid enemy attack.
Kicks Yonaburu out of the line of fire, saving him from being hit by a javelin.
Smiles and laughs after saving Yonaburu, showing sincere relief and happiness.
Looks back at the platoon suffering in the trenches, showing concern beyond himself.
Asks Yonaburu for help urgently after waking up, indicating trust and reliance on a comrade.
Twists and kicks Yonaburu out of the line of fire, neatly avoiding a javelin attack.
Smiles and laughs after saving Yonaburu, showing wonder and relief.
Fails to notice the severe injury (90mm hole through chestplate) and continues to focus on the battle.
Wakes up abruptly in barracks, coughing and gasping, appearing disoriented and trapped.
Explains his fear and desperation to Yonaburu, showing vulnerability and seeking help.
Thanks Yonaburu sincerely, calling him 'buddy' and 'the best'.
Stares at Yonaburu feeling betrayed when Yonaburu calls him out as sick to Sgt. Farell.
Explains situation urgently and emotionally to Yonaburu, showing awareness of danger and trying to convince him to act.
Runs away impulsively and appears disoriented and physically unwell, chewing aspirin messily.
Relies on Yonaburu to calm the situation and come up with a plan, showing lack of immediate strategic thinking.
Shows emotional vulnerability and desperation, which undermines his confidence and perceived capability.
Tackles Yonaburu after feeling betrayed and cries out for help.
Freaks out and knocks away the hypo gun to avoid being injected, then uses a bone saw to escape.
Tackles a much bigger soldier (Yonaburu) despite the obvious physical disadvantage.
After being punched and injured, he remains defiant and tries to explain his knowledge of the future to the medic.
Freaks out and knocks away the hypo gun aimed at his head, preventing an injection.
Uses a bone saw to cut off his zip-tied hands and escapes the medical bay despite being injured and disoriented.
Smiles down at the scared little girl and greets her kindly despite being out of breath and sunburned.
Runs away from the base, avoiding confrontation and responsibility, effectively going AWOL.
Sawing off zip-ties and escaping from captivity despite panic and chaos.
Running through the base in someone else's clothes, keeping his head low to avoid detection.
Slipping through a fence opening and attempting to put it back to avoid suspicion.
Running to the beach and successfully escaping the base undetected.
Interacting with the little girl and old man in a friendly, relaxed manner after escape.
Picks up the little girl and moves her to dry sand away from the oily water.
Covers the little girl's eyes to shield her from the violent attack.
Calls for help loudly when the mimics attack.
Expresses sorrow and apologizes as he is unable to save the little girl.
Frowns at the polluted water and instinctively picks up the little girl to move her to safety.
Covers the little girl's eyes and runs to protect her when the Mimic attacks.
Calls for help loudly but no one responds.
Unable to crawl to the little girl due to his lower half being severed, shows physical vulnerability and inability to protect effectively.
Apologizes to Yonaburu before attempting suicide.
Invites Yonaburu to get breakfast despite Yonaburu's refusal.
Stares distantly at the poster and contemplates the fate of his comrades, showing empathy.
Attempts suicide by putting a gun to his temple, showing a moment of despair and lack of coping skill.
After surviving, takes aspirin and tries to gather himself, indicating some level of self-care and awareness.
Asks Yonaburu a reflective question about what to do if it were the last day on Earth, showing some introspection and attempt to understand priorities.
Invites Yonaburu to breakfast, attempting social connection despite Yonaburu's refusal, showing some initiative.
Eats alone, avoids eye contact with a hostile dog, looks away.
Politely asks kitchen girl to borrow a pen and explains his situation honestly.
Kitchen girl smiles politely but is afraid of him, indicating Cage's odd or unsettling presence despite his politeness.
Writes '5' on the back of his hand to keep track of how many times he dies and wakes up again.
Asks the kitchen girl where the holovid library is, showing initiative to gather information.
Eats alone and looks away from a deadly look from one of Rita's dogs, showing avoidance rather than confrontation.
Wincing over the bitter coffee and drinking it anyway.
Remembers his father taking him to see satellites and reflects on it with a sense of wonder.
Describes the military and political response to the alien threat in a neutral, factual manner without emotional detachment or hostility.
Describes the Mimics and their behavior with a tone of observation and concern.
Provides detailed, insightful narration about the Mimics' evolving tactics and biology, showing understanding of the enemy.
Describes the Mimics as adapting and improving in response to human attacks, indicating awareness of the strategic situation.
Watches holovids of Rita's victory while lazily eating snacks on his stepfather's couch, hoping to avoid military service.
Stays up all night watching holovids and praying his service card would never come.
Stares in shock at his shiny blue service card, showing initial unpreparedness.
Observes the medal ceremony and Rita's tear with a reflective, somber tone.
Notes the fear and desperation of recruits, including himself, showing empathy.
Mentions the grim reality of war and stakes without bitterness or cynicism.
Knows exactly how the battle is going to go, having been there before.
Looks out of place and scared among other soldiers.
Asks a thoughtful question about the battle plan despite social pressure and nervousness.
Stands alone among a thousand soldiers, showing willingness to speak up.
Ignores the mocking and hostile reactions from peers like Griff and Ford.
Questions the official battle plan by pointing out a potential flaw in the intel and suggesting the enemy might anticipate their moves.
Stands alone among a thousand soldiers during the briefing, showing confidence to speak up despite social pressure.
Coughs nervously and stammers while asking questions, indicating lack of confidence or experience.
Fails to convince the officers or peers, who dismiss his concerns and mock him, showing limited influence or authority.
Says someone should speak up despite social disapproval.
Declines invitation to liquor raid, possibly isolating self.
Admits to not being a good soldier and expresses fear about certain death.
Avoids social interaction and wanders alone in locker room.
Asks some pretty good questions that challenge the higher-ups, showing courage and critical thinking.
Declines to join the liquor raid before battle, possibly indicating avoidance or lack of confidence.
Expresses doubt about his own abilities and fears certain death, showing self-awareness but also lack of confidence.
Considers practicing with Sgt. Farell in the sparring bay, showing willingness to improve skills.
Accepts intense sparring from Farell without complaint, persists despite repeated failures.
Responds respectfully to Farell's tough coaching, says 'Yes, sir' eagerly.
Puts on the jacket and attempts to use it despite initial difficulty.
Struggles repeatedly in sparring, getting knocked down and failing to fire in time.
Finally lands a blow on Farell after persistent effort.
Shows willingness to learn and tries again after being bested.
Shakes a terrified soldier off the dropship, forcing him to jump despite his fear.
Tackles a happy soldier to knock him out of harm's way, saving him from danger.
Shakes off fear and forces terrified soldiers to jump from the dropship, taking decisive action under pressure.
Tackles a happy soldier to knock him out of harm's way as the dropship crashes, showing quick thinking and protective instincts.
Moves past terrified comrades to approach Sgt. Farell who is screaming orders uselessly, indicating initiative and leadership.
Moves past terrified comrades to take charge and suggests a tactical retreat to a canyon, convincing Sgt. Farell to follow.
Tells Yonaburu to stay with him, showing concern for his comrades' safety.
Leads by example, shooting a mimic to protect others and fighting hand-to-hand despite overwhelming odds.
Identifies the imminent threat and suggests a tactical retreat to a canyon one kilometer west, convincing Sgt. Farell to move the soldiers out of a doomed trench.
Leads by example by firing his 20mm weapon to take down a pursuing Mimic, encouraging other soldiers to follow his lead.
Engages in close combat with a Mimic, successfully using a piledriver move to kill it despite being knocked sideways.
Grabs Yonaburu's foot and drags him to safety while firing at enemies with his free arm.
Refuses to let Yonaburu go despite his request, showing determination to help his friend.
Smiles at Yonaburu after waking up, despite the grim situation.
Rams his piledriver into the mimic's craw, killing it despite the javelin fizzling.
Grabs Yonaburu's shoulder and runs with him to avoid danger.
Drags wounded Yonaburu while firing with one arm, trying to protect him.
Distracted by Yonaburu's fading words and fails to see the mimic attacking him, resulting in a crushing blow.
Wakes up smiling and writes a '6' on his hand, showing resolve and acceptance of repeated attempts to improve.
Warns Kimmel about the Sarge's arrival, showing friendly concern.
Attempts to organize a welcome party for Sgt. Farell, indicating good-natured and inclusive behavior.
Steps up to address the room and inform everyone about the Sarge, demonstrating openness and sincerity.
Notices the arrival of Sgt. Farell and warns others promptly, causing soldiers to quickly prepare and hide prohibited items.
Attempts to engage Sgt. Farell with a somewhat awkward and indirect approach, trying to distract or placate him.
Begins to sing an improvised cheer to boost morale despite the tense situation.
Responds respectfully and obediently to Sgt. Farell's threat without argument.
Begins to sing an improvised cheer to boost morale despite the tense situation.
Responds respectfully and obediently to Sgt. Farell's threat without hesitation.
Has a '6' written on his hand, indicating some form of marking or tracking but does not explain or act on it here.
Tells others to give it a rest when they gossip about Rita, showing tolerance.
Admits that Rita is better than them, showing sincerity and respect.
Engages in self-deprecating humor about his own abilities, showing humility and openness.
Challenges the group’s negativity and mocks their cynicism, indicating some frustration but also a desire for positivity.
Acknowledges that Rita is better than the others, showing realistic assessment of skill.
Considers the possibility of improving through repeated attempts, referencing a video game analogy.
Engages in sparring despite taking hits and being outmatched by Sgt. Farell, showing persistence and willingness to learn.
Responds to teasing and doubt from peers with seriousness and a smile, indicating confidence and focus.
Initially shows some insecurity or lack of skill as indicated by Yonaburu's mocking comments about his shooting ability.
Leaps to save Yonaburu from a mimic attack, firing between his feet to protect him.
Pushes the platoon forward aggressively, focusing on combat effectiveness.
Engages in intense hand-to-hand combat with Farell, showing determination to improve.
Obliterates a mimic with his piledriver and pushes the platoon forward, firing seeker shells to kill nine mimics at once.
Leaps and fires to save Yonaburu from a mimic attack, showing quick reflexes and situational awareness.
Engages in close combat with Farell, taking heavy hits and staggering, showing he is outmatched in hand-to-hand fighting.
Expresses determination to be the best despite being beaten, showing motivation but not necessarily skill.
Fights back fiercely against Sgt. Farell's relentless beating, showing determination and resilience.
Watches Rita fight mimics closely, showing interest and perhaps respect for her skills.
Asks Yonaburu repeatedly for the time, seemingly to gauge his own limits, showing a personal, somewhat vulnerable side.
Warns Yonaburu to look out for the incoming strikejet, showing concern for his comrade's safety.
Fights back against Sgt. Farell's relentless beating, lands blow after blow on a mimic, and kicks it into a heap despite being barely able to stand.
Asks for the time repeatedly to gauge how far he can get, showing situational awareness and strategic thinking.
Watches Rita's fight closely, learning from her tactics and following her movements.
Fails to keep distance as advised by Rita and is put in danger by a strikejet crash.
Shouts a warning to Yonaburu when he is attacked by a Mimic.
Fires to protect Yonaburu after he is bitten.
Warns Yonaburu about the grenade rolling back under him.
Piles a variety of food on his plate to keep life interesting, despite others' reactions.
Gives Yonaburu a nickname ('Yobo') despite Yonaburu's discomfort.
Fires at the aquatic Mimic immediately after it attacks Yonaburu.
Notices the grenade rolling back under Yonaburu and tries to warn him.
Piles food of every imaginable variety on his plate, adding salt, sugar, spices to break monotony.
Calls Yonaburu by a nickname despite his protests.
Collides with a dog while distracted watching Rita, showing inattentiveness but no hostility.
Pushes back after being pushed by Heeler, engages in a fight in self-defense.
Studies Rita's holovid closely, noticing her loneliness and melancholy, showing empathy and sensitivity.
Pushes back when Heeler pushes him, then swings his tray quickly and lands a good punch despite being outmatched in size and strength.
Distractedly collides with a dog while watching Rita, showing lack of situational awareness.
Intently studies Rita's holovid moves, freezes and rewinds frames to analyze her actions and emotions closely.
Shares admiration for Rita's fighting skills openly with Farell.
Responds to Farell's questions with some hesitation and uncertainty.
Fends off Farell's punch with one hand, showing some physical skill and resilience.
Lies on his back after being kicked, frowning, indicating he was bested in the sparring.
Acknowledges and respects the skill of Rita, showing awareness of superior fighters.
Does not understand what an autobalancer is when Farell mentions it.
Has signed infirmary release and organ donation forms, showing some preparedness or acceptance of risk.
Encourages and leads soldiers by calling out 'ALL CLEAR! MOVE OUT!'
Responds to Yonaburu's question with light humor and shares knowledge about weather unpredictability.
Strikes the metal target with such force that he crumples it and sends himself flying, showing physical power but also clumsiness.
Decimates mimics twice as fast and twice as strong as before, impressing other soldiers and leading effectively.
Makes a lighthearted comment about reading and time during combat, showing confidence and composure.
Explains complex weather phenomena to his men while leading them, demonstrating knowledge and ability to communicate effectively.
Organizes an ambush and directs groups of soldiers into position.
Fights fiercely to protect comrades despite overwhelming odds.
Expresses frustration and concern when Yonaburu falls off the cliff.
Organizes an ambush, motions groups of soldiers into position, scans the field with binoculars.
Frowns at the empty vale, notices something is off about the situation.
Fights back fiercely against the mimic ambush despite being outnumbered.
Runs out of ammo on both autocannon and repeater rifle during critical fight.
Jumps onto tank turret, uses torn-off tank cannon as a bludgeon to kill mimics.
Smiles evenly at the Dispensary Captain while negotiating for the memory unit, showing polite and sincere behavior.
Keeps information classified and somewhat secretive when asked about the use of the memory unit.
Thanks the Dispensary Captain by name after receiving the item, indicating friendliness and respect.
Walks with head down, avoiding attention, showing reserved or possibly distant behavior.
Identifies and requests a specific, technical piece of equipment (B93 external memory unit for a Beyer-Michelson exojacket) confidently and with apparent knowledge.
Uses requisition orders smoothly and confidently, convincing the dispensary captain despite initial resistance.
Refuses to disclose classified information when asked about the purpose of the equipment.
Keeps his head down and moves cautiously through the base, showing awareness and prudence.
Expresses skepticism about luck and chance, showing critical thinking about patterns and predictability.
Catches Shasta's glasses before they hit the floor after startling her.
Carefully navigates the base, avoiding confrontation and conflict with others.
Watches from an eave as soldiers fight and laugh, using the distraction to slip past rather than intervene.
Knows every movement of each person on the base, demonstrating keen observation and situational awareness.
Steps onto a moving truck and navigates through a checkpoint unnoticed, showing agility and stealth.
Uses a fight between soldiers as a distraction to slip past guards, indicating tactical thinking.
Winces and awkwardly greets Shasta, showing some social discomfort or lack of confidence in interpersonal interactions.
Catches Shasta's glasses before they fall and returns them politely.
Admits to entering a classified area just to meet Shasta, showing interest in her work.
Offers a useful memory unit to help Shasta with her repair, saving her time and trouble.
Jokes about the creepy armory guy to lighten the mood.
Requests a valuable item (the battle axe) in exchange for the memory unit, showing a practical and somewhat transactional side.
Successfully sneaks into a classified area without being stopped.
Identifies the damaged external memory unit on the machinery by observation.
Obtains a replacement memory unit from an unlikely source (the armory guy) to help Shasta.
Attempts to barter for a valuable item (the battle axe) by leveraging his help.
Admits to fighting without his autobalancer, acknowledging he is unusual but takes it as a compliment.
Removes excess weapons to 'lighten up' and fight more sleekly, showing self-awareness and consideration for effectiveness.
Leads the platoon courageously against overwhelming odds, fighting like a berserker with a battle axe.
Fights with his exojacket off despite warnings about overloading the autobalancer.
Removes multiple weapons to 'lighten up' and chooses to fight with a huge battle axe instead.
Leads the platoon to the crest of a hill despite the presence of a large enemy force.
Charges directly at a massive and dangerous Megareaver enemy.
Leaps onto the Megareaver, kills it decisively, then rallies the soldiers with a battle cry.
Smiles and jokes with Sgt. Farell after the fight, showing camaraderie.
Leads the men into battle, actively protecting Yonaburu by deflecting shots aimed at him.
Dives out of the Megareaver's attack, evades javelins, climbs onto its back, and hacks off its arm and head, killing the creature.
Wipes his faceplate and rallies the soldiers with confidence, leading them onward.
Communicates clearly and effectively with Sgt. Farell, confirming sector status and requesting support.
Smiles and confidently claims knowledge and skill in fighting, showing self-assurance.
Leads the charge against a massive Mimic horde, fighting alongside his men and protecting comrades.
Leads men into battle, fights to protect Yonaburu by deflecting shots aimed at him.
Expresses concern and apologizes to Yonaburu while in pain and helpless.
Runs and fights leading men against the Mimic horde, deflecting shots aimed at a comrade.
Dispatches mimics effectively, clearing the area around them.
Experiences severe pain and spasms, collapses helplessly on the battlefield, unable to protect himself or others.
Lies helpless and dying as a comrade is attacked and mutilated nearby.
Yells in frustration and despair about the time of his death, showing vulnerability and sadness.
Attempts to warn and motivate the others by telling them to prepare for the coming battle and to make the most of their last day.
Smashes Kimmel's video game to get attention, disrupting others' leisure without apparent concern for their feelings.
Eats alone while others talk about him, indicating possible social isolation or alienation, but no direct action to engage or connect.
Realizes he is stuck in a time loop and acknowledges the futility of his situation.
Yells in frustration and kicks the wall, showing emotional loss of control.
Attempts to warn and motivate the platoon to prepare for the coming battle despite their disbelief.
Smashes a video game to get attention, using an unconventional method to break the group's apathy.
Admits his own failure and expresses doubt about winning, showing self-awareness but also defeatism.
Kimmel approaches Cage nervously, Cage responds with self-deprecating humor about drinking too much metacoffee.
Cage shares brutally honest and grim details about the fates of other soldiers, including Kimmel, in a blunt and somewhat mocking manner.
Despite the harshness, Cage tries to comfort Kimmel by explaining the inevitability of death and attempts to dissuade him from fighting, showing concern for Kimmel's safety.
Cage mocks Kimmel's physical fitness and prospects in a harsh way, which could be seen as discouraging or unsupportive.
Calmly explains the grim realities of combat to Kimmel, using blunt honesty and dark humor to prepare him mentally.
Uses knowledge of repeated deaths (214 times) to demonstrate experience and insight into the battle situation.
Dismisses Kimmel's feelings and insults him (calling him fat), which may undermine morale and rapport.
Drinks metacoffee excessively and piles disgusting food on his plate, showing disregard for self-care or discipline.
Uses sarcasm and dark humor to cope with stress, which may be a double-edged sword in leadership and competence.
Offers whiskey to the rest of the platoon, showing a gesture of sharing despite their refusal.
Drinks whiskey alone in the howling wind, indicating possible withdrawal or coping alone.
Tunes down the chaotic radio noise to silence and sad music, reflecting internal sorrow or sensitivity.
Fills a gulley with wounded mimics while clearly drunk, showing reckless behavior and possible disregard for safety.
Lights a match to the whiskey and throws it into the ravine, face lit with a hellish glow, appearing insane and dangerous.
Offers whiskey to the platoon, showing camaraderie and confidence.
Jumps with whiskey flying, indicating reckless behavior.
Wanders battlefield surrounded by dead and dying, tuning out radio and focusing on music, suggesting detachment and possible loss of situational awareness.
Fills a gulley with wounded mimics to trap them, showing tactical thinking despite being drunk.
Lights a match to the whiskey and throws it into the ravine, displaying boldness and aggressive tactics.
Looks totally insane while executing the attack, indicating possible impaired judgment.
Jumps from dropship to dropship and swan dives into the water, demonstrating physical skill and daring.
Hauls a mimic up a hill and launches it into space, showing determination and resourcefulness.
Wanders the battlefield playing a handheld video game, paying little attention to the battle and killing mimics without purpose.
Throws himself into a horde of mimics angrily after being forced to drop his game.
Fights alongside Rita, matching her moves and engaging closely for the first time.
Runs at high speed, hauls a mimic up a hill, leaps and grabs a strikejet, forces it into a needle shot above the atmosphere, surviving in low-earth orbit until the mimic explodes.
Wanders the battlefield playing a handheld video game, paying little attention to the battle, dispatching mimics without looking up.
Gets angry when forced to drop the game and throws himself into a horde of mimics, killing without purpose or strategy, nearly overwhelmed.
Matches Rita's moves swing for swing in close combat despite never fighting this close to her before.
Shows off for Rita by killing six Mimics in a complex, ballet-like stroke.
Acknowledges his inability to fight like Rita and tries to improve based on her advice.
Fights alongside Rita as a perfect team, showing cooperation and responsiveness.
Turns to leave after the fight despite Rita's question, showing some detachment.
